last_episode_to_air.name: House of Cards
last_episode_to_air.overview: Tom and Jessie exchange anniversary gifts.

name: 18 to Life
overview: 18 to Life is a Canadian television sitcom that debuted on January 4, 2010, on CBC Television. The series is shown in Quebec on Vrak.TV with the title Majeurs et mari√©s.

episodes.name: A Modest Proposal
episodes.overview: Tom and Jessie announce their engagement, throwing their families into chaos.

episodes.name: No Strings Attached
episodes.overview: Tom and Jessie's attempt to find a place of their own backfires disastrously.

episodes.name: It's My Party
episodes.overview: Jessie makes an ill-fated stab at winning Judith over at her belated bridal shower; while Tom gets roped into letting the dads crash his bachelor party.

episodes.name: Detour
episodes.overview: Tom's manhood is tested when Jessie tries to teach him to drive.

episodes.name: Baby Got Bank
episodes.overview: Jessie and Tom enter the dangerous waters of the joint bank account; Judith tries to hone in on Tara's exercise regime.

episodes.name: Goy Story
episodes.overview: A secret from Ben's past threatens to ignite over a family dinner with a rabbi.

episodes.name: Hanging Pictures
episodes.overview: Tom discovers that parental endorsement does nothing for his sex life.

episodes.name: Phil 'Er Up
episodes.overview: A fight between Phil and Tara forces the newlyweds to take Phil on as a roommate.

episodes.name: Working Noon to Five
episodes.overview: Tom and Phil team up in an ill-fated business scheme; Jessie gets in over her head when helping Judith re-design her kitchen.

episodes.name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
episodes.overview: The parents get trapped in Phil's garage with unresolved tensions and hash brownies; Tom and Jessie duel in the kitchen over what to serve their parents for dinner.

episodes.name: In Sickness and in Health
episodes.overview: Judith and Jessie compete to look after Tom when he gets a cold; Ben is horrified to learn Phil is in Mensa; Tara deals with an irate mailman.

episodes.name: Wingman
episodes.overview: Life as a married man can be all-consuming: arguments, in-laws, make-up sex, normal sex. Luckily Tom has a friend like Carter to remind him that he's still eighteen. So, at Carter's insistence, Tom accompanies him to a campus party for some innocent fun. Innocent, that is, until Carter spots his dream girl and asks Tom to distract her friend by being his Wing Man... his unwed, available Wing Man. With no pressure to hook up, Tom finds it easier to talk to the girl, even tell her things he can't say to Jessie. What's the worst that can happen? The hot girl you're pretending to be interested in wants to have sex? You run off and accidently forget your cellphone? Or your wife calls said cell phone and finds out about the whole thing? Meanwhile Jessie gets a peek into Monica's Sex-In-The-City lifestyle when she helps her design her new pad. The Poster Girl for the Single Life starts to rub off on Jessie. One night at the club, Jessie gets carried away and ends up losing Tom's ring. Now Tom and Jessie both have secrets, and their marriage is about to face its toughest test yet.

episodes.name: One Is the Loneliest Number
episodes.overview: Tom and Jessie take inventory of their past sexual partners. Phil's vacation plans hit a snag when Tara's past catches up with her passport.

episodes.name: 15 Minutes of Shame
episodes.overview: When Wendy does a documentary on why marriages work or fail, the couples do interviews that forces them to rethink their relationships. Meanwhile, Tom just wants to fix a stubborn ceiling leak in the attic.

episodes.name: Part Time Lovers
episodes.overview: Tom and Jessie finds jobs at the same book store, but Jessie is hired for the managing position and Tom is just the janitor. Ben discovers yoga to the dismay of Judith and Phil fights the squirrels running rampant in his backyard.

episodes.name: I Do and I Don't
episodes.overview: Phil pulls a Tom and asks Tara to marry him as a joke. But Tara gets serious and accepts his proposal. Tom divulges one of Carter's secrets which causes a major riff between the two.

episodes.name: Overcooked
episodes.overview: Tom tries to spice up his cooking skills. Tara develops a nack for flirting and starts attending to a new guy, Jeff. Ben learns when and when not to use the phrase "my bad".

episodes.name: Family Portrait
episodes.overview: When Tara gives the Bellows a really awful painting she's made, Ben takes extreme measures to get rid of it. Tom and Jessie misplace a very embarrassing video they made.

episodes.name: Sleepless in the Attic
episodes.overview: When Phil's school pal Serena bikes into town with for a surprise visit, she has an unusual request. Jessie & Tom's sleep troubles lead to a temporary separation.

episodes.name: The Flushing Point
episodes.overview: A row over toilet seat etiquette escalates into an all-out war of the sexes. Judith wants to re-enter the workforce. Phil disguises a turkey fryer as a coffee urn.

episodes.name: Miss Conceived
episodes.overview: Tom discovers a positive pregnancy stick and suddenly everyone is pregnant. Wendy builds a family memory box for her school project.

episodes.name: If a Bellow Falls in the Forest
episodes.overview: Nature is never the same when the families roll onto the campground in an immense R/V. Tom & Jessie escape from their parents only to get lost in the woods.

episodes.name: Like Father, Like Son's Best Friend
episodes.overview: When Tom ropes Carter into helping his father with taxes, Carter blossoms into the 'son Ben always wanted'. A heart-broken Ava crashes out at the loft, Jessie and Tom can't get seem to rid of her.

episodes.name: The Gate
episodes.overview: When Tom's cruel Grandmother discovers he's married, she croaks on the spot, leaving a guilt wracked Tom to invent nice things to say at her Eulogy. Phil builds a gate in the fence dividing their properties so that the Bellows can visit their Grandma's shrine.

episodes.name: House of Cards
episodes.overview: Tom and Jessie exchange anniversary gifts.
